comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: The date 6/3/13 is also visible on the plate.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: On June 4, 1913, the next day, the Wyoming would be in town, immediately after leading the fleet for the celebrations associated with unveiling the Maine Monument.. See en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Wyoming_(BB-32) "Shifting to Annapolis, Maryland on 4 June, Wyoming embarked a contingent of United States Naval Academy midshipmen and took the young officers-to-be on a summer cruise off the coast of New England that lasted into late August." Although the Naval Academy commissioning (graduation) ceremonies are now usually in late May, dates I found for 1912 and 1918 were in the first week in June. So this is probably a crowd of family and friends waiting for some part of the festivities.

comment._content: swanq and lifeasdaddy: Thanks for the info! we will update the source record to reflect these additional details.
